newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Bank Austria weighing CA profit transfer pact.
newsitem.headline: Bank Austria weighing CA profit transfer pact.

text.p: Bank Austria said on Friday it was studying contractual arrangements to allow it and recently acquired Creditanstalt to operate as a single entity for Austrian tax purposes.

"One such arrangement could involve Bank Austria's entry into a control agreement and a profit transfer agreement with Creditanstalt," Bank Austria said in a preliminary offering memorandum. A Bank Austria spokesman confirmed the statement.

The prospectus, released ahead of a Bank Austria preference share issue next month, said a control agreement would subject Creditanstalt to a higher degreee of control by Bank Austria than would otherwise be allowed under Austrian corporate law.
A profit transfer agreement would obligate Creditanstalt to transfer all or a certain portion of its profits to Bank Austria, the memorandum said.
The Bank Austria spokesman said he had nothing to add to the document, which foresaw the two banks "operating more like a single entity for day-to-day purposes".
Bank Austria acquired the state's 70 percent of Creditanstalt ordinary voting shares in January. The deal won cartel authority approval in March.
Bank Austria chief executive Gerhard Randa has insisted the two banks will continue to operate independently in Austria for at least five years. -- Vienna newsroom, +43-1 531 12 254
